intro: Eriospermum duthieae, commonly known as the Duthie's eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, spiky fruits called cypsela, which are adapted for wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
